newsitem.title: USA: Coin Bill net to grow slower than revenues.
newsitem.headline: Coin Bill net to grow slower than revenues.

text.p: Coin Bill Validator Inc said on Thursday it aims to increase its fiscal year revenues by 25 percent, but increased operating expenses in the near term will cause earnings to grow somewhat slower than revenues.
The company said it expects improvemnts in the second half of the fiscal year as operating expenses decline as a percentage of revenues and earnings per share increase.

Coin Bill, a maker of paper currency validation systems, reported revenues for the year ended September 30 of $16.6 million and profits of $272,000, including a $1.1 million pre-tax inventory write-down.
The company said it is increasing its market share in the gaming business, but it expects "significant opportunities" in the global beverage and vending markets.
